You will also learn and be responsible for a variety of lab safety procedures relevant to the specific raised floor\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003Eenvironment, as well as learning and utilizing the specific hardware life cycle workload applications. To that end, you will be trained\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003Eand expected to certify via testing in all specific responsibilities. Specific to the hardware life cycle, you will be expected to rack,\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003Estack, cable (power and network), new hardware, as well as un-rack and pack old hardware and cabling.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWhat is an Apprenticeship?\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EIBM Apprenticeship Program is an official registered apprenticeship recognized by the Department of Labor (DOL). Every\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003Egraduate of a Registered Apprenticeship program receives a nationally recognized credential from the DOL.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EDuring the apprenticeship duration, you will be required to complete specific learning hours and on the job training that has been\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003Eoutlined to ensure you are developing the skills and competencies essential to the role. You will be able to learn and grow at your\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003Eown pace, but we expect most apprentices will complete their learning within 12 months. Once you graduate and receive your\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003Ecertificate from our apprentice program, you will be eligible to apply to available full-time roles at IBM.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho you are\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EAn apprenticeship is about learning. We’re seeking candidates who have the following requirements, but we know you’re just\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003Egetting your career started, and we’re committed to helping you learn and grow. If you’ve had some experience with data analysis or\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003Esimply working in a team oriented environment in the past, you’re exactly the type of candidate we’re looking for.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003ETo be successful, you need:\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EDrive and eagerness to learn\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EAbility to work independently, and in an efficient and organized manner\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EAbility to work collaboratively as part of a team\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EStrong troubleshooting\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003ESome basic knowledge or experience in electrical engineering sciences i.e. Electrical Safety, Electron Theory, AC/DC Basics,\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EWires and Cables, Computer Electronics, Electrical Testing Equipment\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWhat’s the experience?\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EAs an apprentice, you'll join with other apprentices in a local cohort. You'll go through your first few weeks together, learning about\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EIBM and the skills you'll be attaining throughout your apprenticeship. Then, you'll work with your managers and mentors to progress\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003Ethrough your personal skills roadmap, learning and demonstrating new knowledge and competencies through hands-on application\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003Ewith your project teams.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EThis position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003ERelocation assistance is not     "description": "\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Introduction\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIBM has a world class Hardware Compliance engineering team located in Rochester MN that supports product testing from nearly every IBM hardware product. Hardware Compliance has responsibility for assuring that IBM’s products are designed to comply with in every country IBM does business with. Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC) is adherence to FCC regulations. Product Safety is conformance to Hazard Based  Standards supported by underwriters such as UL. Energy Efficiency is conformance to various energy regulations such as U.S. Energy Star and EU Lot 9.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EIBM Hardware Compliance has an immediate need for a hardware engineer. This position is expected to perform physical duties as well as technical duties. The entry level engineer will work at the direction of others supporting various needs for keeping our lab testing product. The position will be a mix of hardware testing and hardware bring up – building hardware, configuring systems, installing OS, installing exercise programs and ensuring the system is ready for engineer to test. This entry level position is expected to learn on the job and advance their skills and grow.\u003C/p\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Your role and responsibilities\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EYour Role and Responsibilities\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EWhat you will do\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003EWork in an agile, collaborative environment to understand requirements, and support testing innovative products and support engineering compliance\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EPerform EMC testing of hardware products at the direction of senior engineers.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EWork to accommodate changing priorities in a fast paced environment. The consultant uses data/analytics, bench-marking, research and other techniques to inform the design of strategies that can transition rapidly to execution for immediate impact. Successful engagements will accelerate client adoption of IBM software platforms and drive sustainable software revenue growth. The consultant should excel at quantitative analysis – including the use of data science tools -- to assess growth opportunities, identify root causes and solve business problems. The consultant will also have a strong background in technology and the business of software to derive high-quality insights from the analyses they perform. We represent and support all IBM businesses horizontally and vertically. Our work crosses nearly every category of output: research and strategy, communications and content development, symbology and systems, digital and physical experiences, tools, and training. We aim to maintain the modernity, tangibility, and understanding of the IBM brand worldwide.\u003C/p\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Your role and responsibilities\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe Blue Studio seeks an experienced and highly motivated Executive Producer to oversee various projects. The Executive Producer works alongside Creative Directors, Associate Creative Directors, writers, video production, and IBM stakeholders to create motion, audio, live experiences, thought leadership, client stories, podcasts, and product promotion campaigns. They work directly with production vendors and are the point of contact for stakeholders throughout the process. \u003Cbr style=\"background-repeat: no-repeat; box-sizing: inherit; line-height: 24px; scrollbar-width: auto; scrollbar-color: #a8a8a8 #f5f5f5; font-family: IBMPlexSans, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; background-color: #ffffff;\"/\u003E\u003Cbr style=\"background-repeat: no-repeat; box-sizing: inherit; line-height: 24px; scrollbar-width: auto; scrollbar-color: #a8a8a8 #f5f5f5; font-family: IBMPlexSans, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; background-color: #ffffff;\"/\u003EBlue Studio Executive Producers deeply understand how a story amplifies and empowers a full surround of content across its supporting assets such as social, web, articles, and event assets. They are versed in storytelling techniques and have worked with vendors of all kinds and sizes. They are excellent communicators, collaborators, and great presenters. Blue Studio Executive Producers bring people along through the complex content creation process and can communicate clearly and empathically. They can handle moments of high pressure and bring calmness and clarity, keeping productions positive for all those involved. They are creative problem solvers at their core, applying critical thought to whatever obstacles get in their way, always looking for solutions that allow for the best creative output. \u003Cbr/\u003E\u003Cbr/\u003E\u003C/p\u003E \u003Cul id=\"isPasted\" style=\"background-repeat: no-repeat; If so, lets talk\u003C/p\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Your role and responsibilities\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EYour Role and Responsibilities\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EHave you heard about agile development, but want to learn more about how it ‘works’? Are you someone that has a foundational understanding of\u003Cbr/\u003Edevelopment or programming concepts, but want to take a less traditional path to achieve it?\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cbr/\u003EThis role is multi-faceted and consists of providing lab support and hands on Power I/O Concurrent Maintenance (IOCM) testing. The lab work is to\u003Cbr/\u003Esupport both Development and Test teams in the Rochester, MN lab, providing hardware set-up on Central Electronic Complex (CECs) and I/O\u003Cbr/\u003EExpansion drawers, configuration changes, adapter &amp; cable add/remove, firmware updates, Operating System updates, Virtual Machine (VM)\u003Cbr/\u003Emanagement, Hardware Management Console (HMC) management, and security compliance for Power systems. The IOCM work is hands on end-\u003Cbr/\u003Eto-end testing in the Rochester lab, defining and executing test cases, creating defects for issues found, working with Development to resolve the\u003Cbr/\u003Eissues, and verifying fixes.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cbr/\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWhat is an Apprenticeship?\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cbr/\u003EIBM Apprenticeship Program, which lasts approximately 12 months, is an official registered apprenticeship recognized by the Department of Labor\u003Cbr/\u003E(DOL). Every graduate of a Registered Apprenticeship program receives a nationally-recognized credential from the DOL.\u003Cbr/\u003EDuring the apprenticeship duration, you will be required to complete specific learning hours and on the job training that has been outlined to ensure\u003Cbr/\u003Eyou are developing the skills and competencies essential to the role. You will be able to learn and grow at your own pace, but we expect most\u003Cbr/\u003Eapprentices will complete their learning within 12 months. Once you graduate and receive your certificate from our apprentice program, you will be\u003Cbr/\u003Eeligible to apply to available full-time roles at IBM.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cbr/\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho You Are\u003C/strong\u003E\u003Cbr/\u003EAn apprenticeship is about learning. We’re seeking candidates who have the following requirements, but we know you’re just getting your career\u003Cbr/\u003Estarted, and we’re committed to helping you learn and grow.     "description": "\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Introduction\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAt IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.\u003C/p\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Your role and responsibilities\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n                                                                                            As a Staff AI/MLOps Development Engineer at Apptio, you will work closely with the Engineers, Data Scientists, Product Managers, and Designers in helping our customers discover new savings opportunities in hybrid cloud environments. You will help design and engineer efficient and resilient MLOps platforms and software products that run at 'cloud-scale'. You will participate in design, architecture and code reviews, foster collaboration, and guide the team through roadmap deliverables and other technical challenges. Above all, you will work as a technical leader to provide our customers with great products while helping to grow a strong engineering team.\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EResponsibilities: \u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003EPlay a critical role in setting the MLOPs platform direction and goals for a sizable team, in terms of project impact, ML system design, and ML excellence.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EBe a go-to person to escalate the most complex online/production performance and evaluation issues, that require an in-depth knowledge of how the machine learning system and its components interact with systems around it.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EDevelop and deploy AI models using machine learning techniques such as deep learning, neural networks, and chatbots.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EApply GenAI models as part of the solution and ensure proper cloud or on-prem application pipeline with production-ready quality.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003ESuggest, collect and synthesize requirements and create effective feature roadmap.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EAbility to visualize, articulate and develop an MLops framework and be aware of trade-offs of multiple approaches.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EUnderstand the on-going work and priorities within the team and help plan for the upcoming tasks within the sprint and beyond.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EPartner with the product team to understand the problem space, the competitive landscape and constraints and help deliver engineering solutions that work both for the customer and IBM.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003ELead design/code reviews, provide direction, implement features with high quality secure code, improve test coverage, performance and observability.\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003EMentor junior team members.\u003C/li\u003E\u003C/ul\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Preferred technical and professional experience\n Hardware Compliance has responsibility for assuring that IBM’s products are designed to comply with in every country IBM does business with.  Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC) is adherence to FCC regulations.  Product Safety is conformance to Hazard Based Standards supported by underwriters such as UL.  Energy Efficiency is conformance to various energy regulations such as U.S. Energy Star and EU Lot 9.  Environmental Stewardship is conformance to 4,000+ world wide regulations to ensure we keep our planet safe. \u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp style=\"margin: 0in;font-size: 16px;font-family: Aptos, sans-serif;color: rgb(0, 0, 0);font-style: normal;font-weight: 400;text-align: start;text-indent: 0px;text-decoration: none;vertical-align: baseline;\"\u003E \u003Cbr/\u003EIBM Hardware Compliance has an immediate need for an apprentice hardware technician. Entering this domain positions you at the heart of IBM, where growth and innovation thrive.\u003C/p\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Your role and responsibilities\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EWe are seeking engineers for photolithography tool ownership, research, and development for semiconductors and related devices. In this role you will understand the fundamental principles and materials and tooling in photolithography through a combination of relevant education and work experience. You will also have strong skills in designing experiments, analyzing data, documenting procedures, and communicating results to a broad team. \u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cbr/\u003E\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003ESome of the job responsibilities include maintaining and qualifying state of the art lithography process equipment and developing processes and materials from an early concept stage into a mature element that enables a leading-edge technology. You will focus on 193nm and i-line lithography tooling (tracks) and target chiplet and packaging technology research and development. You will interact with cross-functional and multi-company working teams that include engineers engaged in all areas of semiconductor including process development, process integration, metrology, operations, and equipment engineering. You must possess strong analytical and design-of-experiment knowledge, demonstrated written and verbal communication skills in English.     "company_id": "8127c509-6bc7-46cd-a95c-06cac602f4fd",
    "description": "\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Introduction\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp data-pm-slice=\"1 1 []\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"\u003EDo you want to grow your career and challenge yourself? Are you interested in designing high-impact solutions to solve complex problems? Do you want to be part of an agile, cross-disciplinary team that collaborates to develop end-to-end solutions? As a member of our IBM Chip Development team, you will have the opportunity to work with world-class talent to develop our next-generation silicon powering our IBM Z and POWER Systems. Our team works in a fast-paced, highly visible, matrixed environment where the opportunities for technical growth and leadership are extensive.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"\u003E \u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"\u003EAs a Verification Engineer, you will be responsible for the pre-silicon functional and performance verification of our chipsets, covering the CPU core, cache/nest subsystem, memory hierarchy, and other on-silicon IP used in our next-generation IBM Systems offerings. You will use state-of-the-art techniques to simulate and verify the designs of these custom microprocessor-based systems. The job uses both hardware and software engineering skills, and entails creating environments and methodologies for simulating the VHDL input, as well as analysis and problem debug. Verification is performed at various levels within the design hierarchy. A background in Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering with strong programming skills is required.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"\u003E \u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E \u003C/p\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Your role and responsibilities\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cul data-pm-slice=\"3 1 []\"\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cp style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"\u003EVerification Design: Help design verification strategies and write object oriented test code to validate pre-silicon logic used in Quantum control system ASIC chips.\u003C/p\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cp style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"\u003EVerification Triage: Contribute to the identification of functional and performance issues pre-silicon production via simulation runs and failure debug/analysis. Implement best practices and innovative methodologies to ensure robust and efficient verification processes.\u003C/p\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cp style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"\u003EDocumentation and Communication: Thoroughly document verification issues, providing comprehensive insights for future reference and continuous improvement. Communicate progress effectively, keeping team members and stakeholders informed of milestones achieved and potential challenges encountered.\u003C/p\u003E\u003C/li\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cp Specifically, we are seeking to fill the role of a Delivery Project Executive. The Delivery Project Executive is the primary client interface for the delivery of our Procurement BPO services to IBM’s external clients.  In addition, the Delivery Project Executive controls costs, manages the customer relationship and reports on all contracted commitments within IBM and Client leadership, and leads the IBM delivery team on the account. In the role, you will be leading our teams in the delivery of BPO Procurement Services to our external clients across all industry segments.     \n                                                                                    \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Your role and responsibilities\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"MsoNoSpacing\" style=\"text-indent: -.25in; The candidate will be a hands-on engineering leader with strong skills in guiding teams, technology definition decisions and materials selection from an early concept into mature elements that enables leading-edge technology. The candidate should also be a motivated self-starter, demonstrating strong understanding of industry trends and lithography roadmap in the interconnect area and able to clearly articulate and influence across departments to drive technical agenda in a fast-paced organization. The position also requires mentoring junior engineers to ensure execution of key workstreams. Hands on experience with CDSEM, stochastics analysis and large area inspection techniques is preferred. Familiarity with computational lithography (OPC/RET development) and test vehicle/mask design is a plus. Generation of Intellectual Property for IBM and protection of it through the patenting process are also expected. These teams design increasingly complex hardware components and rely on robust, scalable, and high-availability software systems to accelerate their work. A strong internal tools engineering team is not just a support function—it’s a force multiplier, enabling experts in physics, and data science to iterate faster, store and analyze critical data, and extend tooling themselves.\u003C/p\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Your role and responsibilities\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto;\"\u003EThe role will inherit a set of disconnected analysis tools that require short-term maintenance and, in some cases, new feature development. However, the real challenge lies in crafting a cohesive and holistic vision for an internal tooling environment that enhances research effectiveness. This is not just about maintaining the status quo—it’s about designing a forward-thinking, adaptable ecosystem that allows researchers to work seamlessly and efficiently.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto;\"\u003EIn an environment where uncertainty is the norm and requirements evolve rapidly, we need a pragmatic and experienced technical lead who can balance best practices with adaptability. This person will work colocated with researchers and scientists, navigating ambiguity to build the internal platforms that drive our innovation forward. People in this role analyze, build and pack server systems and assemblies. They also work with Engineering to model new products and test processes in preparation for final shipment to clients. The employee provides technical support to the business processes. Individual will be working with all MFG areas, Eng and support groups to ensure all processes are physically and logistically manufacturable and repeatable at a high-quality levels and meet/exceed our IBM standards and customers’ requirements by deliverable dates.\u003C/p\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Required education\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n                                                                                            High School Diploma/GED\n                                                                                    \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Preferred education\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n                                                                                            Associate's Degree/College Diploma\n                                                                                    \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Required technical and professional expertise\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E* At least 2-year MFG experience, good knowledge and understanding in our systems build processes.\u003Cbr style=\"box-sizing: inherit; Every graduate of a Registered Apprenticeship program receives a nationally-recognized credential from the DOL.\u003Cbr/\u003E \u003Cbr/\u003EDuring the apprenticeship duration, you will be required to complete specific learning hours and on the job training that has been outlined to ensure you are developing the skills and competencies essential to the role. Our culture of evolution and empathy centers on long-term career growth and development opportunities in an environment that embraces your unique skills and experience.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EIn this role, you'll work in one of our IBM Consulting Client Innovation Centers (Delivery Centers), where we deliver deep technical and industry expertise to a wide range of public and private sector clients around the world. Our delivery centers offer our clients locally based skills and technical expertise to drive innovation and adoption of new technology.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E \u003C/p\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Your role and responsibilities\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAs a managing consultant, you will serve as a client-facing practitioner working collaboratively with clients to deliver high-quality solutions and be a trusted business advisor with deep understanding of SAP Accelerate delivery methodology or equivalent and associated work products. There are opportunities for you to acquire new skills, work across different disciplines, take on new challenges, and develop a comprehensive understanding of various industries. There are opportunities for you to acquire new skills, work across different disciplines, take on new challenges, and develop a comprehensive understanding of various industries.     "description": "\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Introduction\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIBM’s Ceph[1] Engineering organization is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join the CephFS team. In this role you will collaborate with our worldwide Ceph engineering team to develop and enhance CephFS[2], the file system component of the Ceph software-defined distributed storage system. You will design and implement new capabilities and features to enable new use cases while improving scalability, performance and efficiency. You will participate in a vibrant and active open source community[3] to deliver enterprise-quality software.\u003Cbr style=\"caret-color: #242424; color: #242424; font-family: Aptos, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;\"/\u003E\u003Cbr style=\"caret-color: #242424; color: #242424; font-family: Aptos, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;\"/\u003ECephFS comprises a wide-ranging software suite including Linux kernel and userspace clients, a clustered userspace metadata server, and a messaging layer for storing data with Ceph’s native object store (“RADOS”), in addition to higher-level APIs for integrating with other systems (OpenStack, OpenShift, an NFS-Ganesha cluster, Samba, etc). As a member of the CephFS engineering team, you will have the opportunity to learn and work in many of these areas according to your experience and technical background. Candidates will be excited to develop new distributed algorithms to build out end-user features of the filesystem, such as instant cloning, file overlays, and coherent snapshots across multiple clients with a coherent distributed cache.\u003Cbr style=\"caret-color: #242424; color: #242424; font-family: Aptos, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;\"/\u003E\u003Cbr style=\"caret-color: #242424; color: #242424; font-family: Aptos, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;\"/\u003EYou will work remotely with a worldwide team so communication is key. You will collaborate with others using modern open source tools including git (and GitHub), Jenkins, Redmine, and community-developed testing and validation tools.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E[1]: \u003Ca data-auth=\"NotApplicable\" data-linkindex=\"3\" href=\"https://ceph.io/en/news/publications/\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" style=\"border: 0px; font-variant-numeric: inherit; font-variant-east-asian: inherit; font-variant-position: inherit; font-feature-settings: inherit; font-optical-sizing: inherit; font-variation-settings: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #0563c1;\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://ceph.io/en/news/publications/\"\u003Ehttps://ceph.io/en/news/publications/\u003C/a\u003E, \u003Ca data-auth=\"NotApplicable\" data-linkindex=\"4\" href=\"https://www.youtube.com/c/Cephstorage\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" style=\"border: 0px; You will collaborate with other developers and users by attending online meetings, participating in email lists and online chat rooms, preparing written documentation, and giving presentations about your work. You will be expected to work proactively with other team members and the community to develop your own knowledge, and to be ready to mentor new contributors as you develop expertise.\u003Cbr style=\"caret-color: #242424; color: #242424; font-family: Aptos, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;\"/\u003E\u003Cbr style=\"caret-color: #242424; color: #242424; font-family: Aptos, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;\"/\u003EContribute to the development of CephFS by designing and implementing new functionalities that enable innovative use cases. This includes designing new distributed algorithms, implementing them across clients and servers, and writing automated test cases to demonstrate they work. You will also identify and fix bugs and propose performance enhancements. This will involve work across our C++-language Metadata Server cluster and userspace clients, our Linux in-kernel client (which you may either develop on your own, or arrange with our kernel maintainers), and our messaging layer for storing data within Ceph's \"RADOS\" distributed object store.\u003C/p\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Required education\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n                                                                                            None\n                                                                                    \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Preferred education\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n                                                                                            Bachelor's Degree\n                                                                                    \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Required technical and professional expertise\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E* Experience working with C++ codebases, or other systems languages and demonstrated ability\u003Cbr style=\"caret-color: #242424;     "description": "\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Introduction\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAt IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.\u003C/p\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Your role and responsibilities\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAs a Hardware Design Technician Apprentice at IBM, you will learn the mechanical packaging and design of electronic sub-assemblies (power, thermal, IO, planar boards, interconnect frames, brackets, covers etc.) that make up our z and Power systems using three dimensional (3D) CAD tools like Catia, Creo and Solidworks.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E \u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EThroughout your apprenticeship, you’ll work closely with experienced engineers and mentors where you will apply your learning to design parts, assemble early hardware builds and perform application verification testing.  You will have hands on experience with prototypes, troubleshooting field fails and implementing fixes, operating measurement and machining equipment (e.g. 3D printer) and other functions performed by the mechanical design team.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E \u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWhat is an Apprenticeship?\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EIBM Apprenticeship Program is an official registered apprenticeship recognized by the Department of Labor (DOL).  Every graduate of a Registered Apprenticeship program receives a nationally-recognized credential from the DOL.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E \u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EDuring the apprenticeship duration, you will be required to complete specific learning hours and on the job training that has been outlined to ensure you are developing the skills and competencies essential to the role.  You will be able to learn and grow at your own pace, but we expect most apprentices will complete their learning within 12 months.  Once you graduate and receive your certificate from our apprentice program, you will be eligible to apply to available full-time roles at IBM.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E \u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho you are!\u003C/strong\u003E\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EAn apprenticeship is about learning.  We’re seeking candidates who have the following requirements, but we know you’re just getting your career started, and we’re committed to helping you learn and grow.     "description": "\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Introduction\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAs a System Services Representative at IBM, you will serve as the primary technical interface to clients, coordinating hardware and software support while delivering operational services. This role is crucial in ensuring customer satisfaction through exceptional technical support. You will advise clients on preventive maintenance, configuration, operation, and environmental factors that can significantly impact product performance and the overall IT operation of the client. Your responsibilities will include addressing client needs efficiently and effectively, ensuring seamless operational services, and contributing to the smooth functioning of systems and infrastructure. In this position, you will be at the forefront of driving customer satisfaction by providing exceptional technical support. You will coordinate both hardware and software support to meet client requirements, ensuring that all operational services are delivered effectively. Your role will involve on-site installation, maintenance, and repair activities for IBM and multi-vendor systems and components, requiring effective communication, problem-solving skills, teamwork, and adaptability. You will be expected to maintain a high level of professionalism and technical expertise to support our clients effectively. IBM Systems is dedicated to helping IT leaders think differently about their infrastructure. The role demands a blend of technical expertise, strategic foresight, and leadership acumen, coupled with a deep understanding of Salesforce's capabilities, enterprise architecture principles, and security best practices. The EA acts as a bridge between business stakeholders, technical teams, and external partners, ensuring that the Salesforce implementation not only addresses current needs but also provides a foundation for future scalability, flexibility, and innovation. The following delineates the core responsibilities and expectations for this role:\u003Cbr/\u003EArchitectural Design and Governance\u003Cbr/\u003E* Solution Architecture: Design end-to-end Salesforce solutions that include Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Experience Cloud, or other Salesforce products, ensuring scalability, security, and compliance with industry standards.\u003Cbr/\u003E* Integration Strategy: Develop robust integration frameworks for connecting Salesforce with other enterprise systems (e.g., ERP, CRM, data warehouses) using APIs, middleware, and Salesforce integration tools like MuleSoft.\u003Cbr/\u003E* Data Architecture: Define data models, governance frameworks, and migration strategies, ensuring data quality, consistency, and adherence to security policies.\u003Cbr/\u003E* Compliance and Security: Embed security at the core of the architecture, addressing compliance requirements such as GDPR, HIPAA, CCPA, FedRAMP, or FISMA, and implementing Salesforce Shield, encryption, and secure access controls.\u003Cbr/\u003E* Governance Model: Establish a governance structure to standardize processes, enforce development best practices, and ensure alignment with enterprise architecture principles.\u003Cbr/\u003E\u003Cbr/\u003ETechnical Leadership and Development Oversight\u003Cbr/\u003E* Platform Optimization: Leverage Salesforce best practices to optimize performance, including declarative tools, Apex programming, Lightning Web Components (LWCs), and Flow Builder.\u003Cbr/\u003E* Customization vs. Configuration: Evaluate and recommend the appropriate balance between Salesforce configuration and custom development to meet client-specific requirements efficiently.\u003Cbr/\u003E* Technical Guidance: Provide hands-on technical leadership and mentorship to development teams, reviewing code, design documents, and deployment plans to maintain quality and alignment with architectural standards.\u003Cbr/\u003E* Release Management: Define and oversee a robust release management strategy, leveraging tools like Salesforce DevOps Center, Git, and CI/CD pipelines to streamline development and deployment.\u003Cbr/\u003E\u003Cbr/\u003ESecurity and Risk Management\u003Cbr/\u003E* Secure Design Principles: Implement least privilege access, secure session management, and role-based access controls, ensuring alignment with enterprise security policies.\u003Cbr/\u003E* Identity and Access Management (IAM): Design and implement secure authentication mechanisms, including Single Sign-On (SSO), Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), and integration with identity providers (IdPs) like Okta or Azure AD.\u003Cbr/\u003E* Audit and Monitoring: Set up and monitor Salesforce Shield, Event Monitoring, and logging frameworks to detect and mitigate security threats proactively.\u003Cbr/\u003E* Incident Response: Collaborate with security teams to define incident response protocols specific to Salesforce, addressing breaches, vulnerabilities, or compliance violations swiftly.\u003Cbr/\u003E\u003Cbr/\u003EInnovation and Continuous Improvement\u003Cbr/\u003E* Emerging Technologies: Stay abreast of Salesforce innovations, AI capabilities (e.g., Einstein), and industry trends to recommend enhancements and new use cases.\u003Cbr/\u003E* Performance Tuning: Continuously monitor and optimize Salesforce applications to ensure high availability, reliability, and responsiveness.\u003Cbr/\u003E* Feedback Loop: Establish feedback mechanisms to capture lessons learned, user feedback, and evolving requirements, refining the architecture and implementation approach over time.\u003Cbr/\u003E\u003Cbr/\u003EKey Deliverables and Metrics of Success\u003Cbr/\u003E* Architectural Blueprints: Detailed documentation of the Salesforce solution, including process flows, data models, integration diagrams, and security frameworks.\u003Cbr/\u003E* Compliance Assurance: Validation that the Salesforce implementation complies with all applicable regulatory and contractual security requirements.\u003Cbr/\u003E* Operational Metrics: Achievement of performance benchmarks such as reduced downtime, faster deployment cycles, and improved user satisfaction scores.\u003Cbr/\u003E* Business Outcomes: Measurable improvements in key business metrics, such as increased sales productivity, enhanced customer satisfaction, and streamlined operations.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin: 0in; font-size: 16px; font-family: Aptos, sans-serif; caret-color: Watson Research Center in Yorktown Heights, NY. The team focuses on delivering quantum processor and processor-adjacent designs to meet a variety of internal needs, and develops and drives the methodology to make these designs successful. Designs span in scope from exploratory research to production-roadmap quantum processor unit development.\u003C/p\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__label\"\u003E\n                                                Your role and responsibilities\n                                            \u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article__content__view__field__value\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe successful candidate will join the core quantum processor unit (QPU) design team, contributing directly both to processor designs (consisting of networks of interconnected/coupled qubits with the full infrastructure for control/readout) and testsite designs in support of innovation breakthroughs for QPU technologies. This role will focus on microwave engineering aspects of QPU design, and requires strong familarity with traditional microwave engineering and test procedures. Familiarity with network theory and non-linear microwave concepts is a bonus. In addition, the role involves continual interlock and work with the experimental team to continually identify and close gaps in model-hardware correlation, driving advancement of the quantum hardware design and simulation flows. Applicants are expected to have experience with relevant hardware development tools such as Keysight ADS, Ansys Electronics Desktop, Cadence Virtuoso/Spectre etc. Familiarity with quantum device design and/or quantum computing engineering is preferred. Because the role includes collaboration between several diverse and dynamic teams of technical and operations personnel, good communication skills, initiative, and a strong sense of responsibility are We are seeking qualified and motivated candidates for a position as Design Automation and Infrastructure Engineer. \u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 0in .5in;\"\u003E \u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 0in .5in;\"\u003EThe hired candidate will have experience with electrical engineering, and/or computer engineering, and/or semiconductor physics. The candidate must understand the principles of semiconductor physics, physical layout design, and design infrastructures development. The candidate will work closely with process development engineers, device engineers, reliability engineers, health of line engineers and layout technicians to create layout automation that meets the intent of the above engineers. The hired candidate must also possess strong analytical and design-of-experiment knowledge, excellent written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to articulate difficult concepts to an audience with diverse technical backgrounds. \u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 0in .5in;\"\u003E \u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 0in .5in;\"\u003EThe job responsibilities include developing test structure layouts using design automation by SKILL coding, using industry standard (EDA) tools including the Cadence Virtuoso Design Environment, and design infrastructure development with SKILL/Python/Perl. The position involves developing parametrized cells (p-cells) for use in design automation. Engineers in this position interpret design rules and macro specifications, collaborating with engineers from other functional areas to achieve the desired structure while ensuring that designed layouts pass Design Rule Checks (DRC). Specified layouts will be primarily test structures rather than working circuitry. Close and frequent cooperation with development engineers from interdisciplinary teams will be required for this dynamic team environment. More experienced individuals will participate in coordination of projects, teams, and/or infrastructure development.\u003C/p\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003C/div\u003E\n\u003Cdiv To that end, you will be trained in the use of state-of-the-art tools to test, manipulate and inspect product chips, and work with our engineers to interpret and consolidate the obtained data.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E \u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E \u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EWhat is an Apprenticeship?\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EIBM Apprenticeship Program is an official registered apprenticeship recognized by the Department of Labor (DOL).  Every graduate of a Registered Apprenticeship program receives a nationally-recognized credential from the DOL.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E \u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EDuring the apprenticeship duration, you will be required to complete specific learning hours and on the job training that has been outlined to ensure you are developing the skills and competencies essential to the role.  You will be able to learn and grow at your own pace, but we expect most apprentices will complete their learning within 12 months.  Once you graduate and receive your certificate from our apprentice program, you will be eligible to apply to available full-time roles at IBM.\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cbr/\u003E\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EWho you are\u003C/p\u003E\u003Cp\u003EAn apprenticeship is about learning.
